alert.note: Alert for Sawtooth, Stanley Basin (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:35PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact the Boundary Fire burn scar in northwestern Custer County through 430 PM MDT... At 331 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 27 miles northwest of Stanley, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Additional rainfall could potentially lead to flooding issues with the Boundary Fire burn scar as storms continue to track over the area. Locations impacted include... Dagger Falls and Seafoam Ranger Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding as additional storms track over the area. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
